intro: Carum korolkowii, commonly known as Siberian parsley, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family, and its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. Carum korolkowii thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine and steppe environments. Its botanical features make it an important plant for both ecological and medicinal purposes.
